title: "Esmeralda" elegant script
content:
Can anyone id the font used for Esmeralda?

Apologies for the poor image quality. That is the only one I was provided.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [resort.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214630/http:/typophile.com/files/resort.jpg) | 41.7 KB |

 [‹ (x) Looking for a narrow sans similar to Bebas - various {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214630/http:/typophile.com/node/32488 "Go to previous forum topic") [technical drawing font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081207214630/http:/typophile.com/node/32472 "Go to next forum topic")
author: umlautthoni

comments.content: I think you’ll find this is a pretty standard copperplate script – something like Calligraphiques, Kuenstler Script, Palace Script, Marina Script, Youthline etc. but with a little hand-drawn swash on the top of that lowercase d. The capital ’E’ may have been squished a bit.
